title: News website generates Error message
content:
When I try to visit the haaretz.com website, I see this error:

"Error 403 Forbidden

Forbidden Guru Mediation:

Details: cache-sea4465-SEA 1605432384 3437095828

Varnish cache server"

Anyone have any idea what causes this and how to fix it? I can access this website on Chrome, Brave and MS Edge.
creator: richards1052

title: Pressing CTRL+Shift+P doesn't open a Private Window.
content: Pressing the button normally works, but using the keyboard shortcut doesn't. It also doesn't work in safe mode.

title: login Amazon impossible
content:
Since one week it is impossible to use Firefox to access my Amazon acount. I did uninstall FF and reinstalled, no success. After entering my email and clicking continue it stops.

At the same time the recaptcha doesnt work. So i presume there is some connection here between the two issues.

I had exactly the same problem on another computer which i could solve using an image. Unfortunately i dont have one for this computer.

I really dont understand whats going on, tried already many things, nothing works.

Google chrome and explorer work perfectly.

Anybody has an idea? Thank you
creator: c.vanderiet

title: DNS over HTTPS custom provider (ASUS)
content: I would like a custom provider (ASUS) when enabling the DNS over HTTPS on my Firefox. I would like to know what is the format of the custom provider , ie www.asus.com or www.google.com . thanks
creator: dimi_papa

title: Firefox goes behind the taskbar coming out of minimize after being maximized
content:
Windows 10 running Firefox 82.0.3

With a slightly transparent taskbar, Firefox windows goes behind the taskbar after being minimized (or closed) and restored again. Maximizing is fine, it sits nicely above it. I noticed also after restoring it, if you right click inside Firefox, it fixes itself and also when you focus on another window.

I attached a GIF.
creator: chris--

title: Firefox Container blocking Facebook.com web pages?
content: I installed Firefox Facebook container, thinking I could at last feel safe signing up and using Facebook. So I went to the public Facebook.com pages about privacy to examine the latest in their privacy settings, no login required of course. However I was stopped repeatedly by the following error message: Your Request Couldn't be Processed There was a problem with this request. We're working on getting it fixed as soon as we can. I then pasted the same Facebook.com web address into Edge and had no problems viewing facebook.com pages open to the public. Again, I am not trying to sign in and do not have an active Facebook account. Does Firefox management know if Facebook is sabotaging Facebook Container either deliberately or by neglect, or if Facebook is actually working on allowing the use of Facebook Container on Firefox while using Facebook.com pages?
creator: Quenchoo

title: My Firefox for Mac is update. But when I view a streaming movie, images are jerky and sound is hesitant or shaky.Why?

title: Updated to 82.0.3 (64 bit). Now I can't sign in to the Chase Bank website.
content: Updated to 82.0.3 (64 bit). Now I can't sign in to the Chase Bank website. (I was able to get there using MS Edge). When will you have an update to fix this?
creator: hartlepooley

title: Disable Ctrl + Shift + Q
content:
Is there some way to disable Ctrl + Shift + Q without installing 3rd party software? Most of the key mapping extensions contain security warnings.

I find myself constantly frustrated that a "destructive" action like quit has been put so closely beside a productive option like cycle back a tab. The combination of having Ctrl + Shift + Q beside Ctrl + Shift + Tab is quite obnoxious on a QWERTY keyboard. I would like to try map this to something that makes more sense like Ctrl + Shift + E or Ctrl + Alt + Q.

I'm running Firefox 82.0.3.
creator: conor.oflaherty

title: Google scam in Firefox?
content: On my PC (not laptop) in Google search, Google wants me to sign in before I can use Google. Looks like a scam? How do I geet around it.

title: Malware Auto Download with Capital One Download URL
content:
I happened on a page: https://capitaloneshopping.com/join-capital-one-shopping?utm_source=Meerkat&utm_campaign=107592707702&utm_term=472928718855&gclid=EAIaIQobChMI0Ij6h5iD7QIVgi0MCh2TLgrJEAEYASAAEgJALvD_BwE

And it immediately began "downloading an app" and I quit the page before it could get far, but, obviously, that doesn't mean it stopped. However, now Firefox is acting a little wiggy, and I'm concerned it might have downloaded something that's affecting the browser. Was trying to read about "capital one shopping malware," and pages wouldn't open when any links on the search results were clicked, etc.

Is this a known issue? Resolutions offered?
creator: info.ghost

title: I cannot open my Facebook Page in Firefox
content: Every time in the last two months that I try to go to my Facebook page, I get a message, "This Page Isn't Directing Properly". I do not know what to do. There are times when I can put in my page info and go to the page, but not in last two weeks. How can I fix this? Sandy
